Name: Small papyriform column
Description: This amulet in green feldspar (?) takes the form of a papyriform column, which represents the hieroglyphic sign signifying "to be green", "to be prosperous". On the column is engraved the name of the owner, who probably lived in the New Kingdom. The piece, which has a hole for suspension, was part of the É. de Meester de Ravestein collection.
